content:
ACT
94.  
Invalidity of reciprocal will of spouses
A reciprocal will of spouses becomes invalid if:
 1) a marriage was divorced or has been terminated before the death of the bequeather;
 2) the bequeather has filed a claim with a court for divorce or agreed to divorce in writing before his or her death;
 3) at the time of his or her death the bequeather is entitled to claim annulment of the marriage and has filed the corresponding claim with a court.
The provisions of subsection 1 of this section shall not apply, if it can be presumed that the bequeather intended otherwise.
Chapter 5
